Roasting the garlic takes the edge off, while a hit of mint adds a dose of contrasting coolness. To roast a whole head of garlic in a fraction of the time, separate the cloves from the bulb, then cook them on the stove rather than in the oven. Reprinted With Permission From COOK90: The 30-Day Plan for Faster, Healthier, Happier Meals By David Tamarkin, Published By Little, Brown and Company, 2018.IngredientsMakes about 1½ cups1head of garlic, cloves separated, unpeeled2cups parsley leaves with tender stems1cup mint leaves1cup extra-virgin olive oil1tsp. finely grated lemon zest4tsp. fresh lemon juice1tsp. crushed red pepper flakes¾tsp. kosher saltPreparationStep 1Heat a medium heavy skillet, preferably cast iron, over medium. Toast garlic, tossing occasionally, until skins are darkened on all sides and cloves are softened, 12–15 minutes. Let cool.Step 2Peel garlic; discard skins and transfer cloves to a blender. Add parsley, mint, oil, lemon zest and juice, red pepper flakes, and salt. Blend until a pesto-like sauce forms.Step 3Do Ahead: Sauce can be made 1 week ahead. Cover and chill.How would you rate Toasted Garlic–Herb Blender Sauce?Leave a ReviewTell us what you thinkReviews (1)Back to TopTriangleAmazing!  Great way to use a plethora of herbs from the garden.  Added 1 C of fresh Basil as well.  The toasted garlic was fantastic.  Only used 1/2 C of oil.  Have drizzled it on potatoes, salmon, and have made a pasta salad.
